body:
**Problem**:
Currently, default prompt % is treated as comment-start. As a
result it gets added to everyline when fomratoptions+=r is set.
% is treated as comment because of global default value of 'comments'
option contains '%'.

**Solution**:
Set default value of 'comments' option to '' in prompt buffer.

followup to #33371
working toward #34561

comment_regular_data.body:
@justinmk are there anything else that effect things like this?

Also, what does copyindent do? I assumed it copies the indentation level of the previous line. But that works without copyindent being set. I actually think this is a useful behavior in prompt buffer too. Imagine writing a markdown list to llm in prompt. fixing indent would be pretty annoying by hand. I think we can take out formatoptions since it mostly seems to deal with comments and leave copyindent in?

> I assumed it copies the indentation level of the previous line. But that works without copyindent being set. I actually think this is a useful behavior in prompt buffer to

there are many such indent-related options.

we can start without just 'formatoptions' for now.

alternatively, if multiline mode moved line 1 of the prompt below the prompt char (as suggested elsewhere),

```
% (multiline)
line 1
line 2
...
```

Then we wouldn't need to touch 'formatoptions', because the prompt char wouldn't be in the editable region anymore.

@justinmk instead of disabling `fomratoptions` we should just set a default value for 'comments' option in prompt-buffer. 'comments' option already gets set differently for different `filetypes`. It's mostly done in `ftplugins` or `indents`. So it makes sense to just have e default value for prompts. Plugins can then set their value if they want to. I'm setting it to empty string for now.
